nodes.text: The Bathhouse, located in the Alaphoe Gardens on Procopia in the Tapani sector, was a large split-level marble structure on a small hill that overlooked both Alaphoe Lake and the ocean.

The upper level of the Bathhouse contained three open bathing pools that were covered. Potted plants chairs and other furnishings lined the patio area of these pools. The primary level was sealed against the elements and its walls were covered in frescos of attractive scenes and marine animals native to the Procopian oceans.
